learning_outcomes.description: explain the importance of homeostasis in human survival, including the importance of the cellular environment and the cell membrane, cellular communication, and integration of cellular responses
describe the structure of the cells, tissues and organs that constitute some of the human organ systems

identify the principal components, relevant anatomical features and relationships of some of the human organ systems on human cadaveric specimens and communicate effectively using correct anatomical terminology
explain how human body systems maintain health
explain the integration and control of the major body systems

recognise the link between human biology and disease processes and predict some functional deficits that may occur as a result of altered structure, within an ethical framework of respect for both living and deceased humans
identify the causes, risk factors, symptoms and treatment options of common health disorders
explain the mechanisms of actions of common drugs which affect the cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, renal, respiratory, nervous, immune and endocrine systems

assessments.task_description: Your CC will discuss the frequency and style of these assessments in first week of the course. Further assessment details will be provided on Blackboard during the semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester examination is your first major examination for this course. This in-semester examination will test the knowledge from all weeks except week 5. This examination will be MCQs only. It will comprise of 40 questions with 10 minutes of perusal time.

The exam will be a closed book invigilated exam held on campus, undertaken via the Inspera eAssessment platform. Students will be required to bring a laptop to the exam that meets the device requirements for Inspera. It is important that you check before the exam that your laptop meets the device requirements for using the Inspera Assessment platform. If you do not own a suitable laptop, you can borrow one from the Library. The Library website Get familiar with Inspera provides the latest information for students about using Inspera. Further information about the exam will be provided on Blackboard.

Have your UQ student ID card available for all your exams. 

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 12 To Week 14(12 May - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Placements

During placements, students gain practical, hands-on experience in healthcare settings under the supervision of registered nurses and clinical educators. Students will apply the theoretical knowledge learned in their studies to real-world scenarios, developing essential clinical skills such as patient assessment, administering medications, wound care, and monitoring vital signs. Students also will learn to communicate effectively with patients, families, and healthcare teams while building professional behaviors and confidence. Placements expose students to various clinical environments, such as hospitals, aged care facilities, community health centers, or mental health services, helping them understand the diverse roles of nurses and preparing them for future practice. Further details about your placements are available from you school.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08
